reviews.review_msg: Ena is a very caring and kind hearted prof in many aspects. She created a fantastic learning environment that everyone benefited from. The only downside to Ena was that she disapproves the use of Canvas for some reason and makes everything hard copy/in-person to which I didn't like. Despite all this, she is great prof and I thoroughly recommend

Best professor I've ever had!  Dr.Lee is so incredibly passionate and knowledgeable.  The way she approaches education is refreshing and makes you want to lean in to any subject she speaks about.  I would100% recommend taking anything she teaches, it will change you!

Ena gives wonderful feedback and is a fair marker. I had her during the height of the pandemic and she was extremely accomodating and caring! she did a lot of breakout room times to promote discussion about the readings. she's a passionate and extremely positive person.

educ 382 was such a great class! ena was a wonderful professor, she understands the struggles that students go through and caters everything for us. she even cancelled an assignment for us because the majority of the class was flooded with assignments and exams from various classes! she also gives amazing feedback on your papers

She's amazing. Best prof I've come across at SFU so far in 5 years. I don't usually write these professor ratings, but I had to do it for her. Weekly discussions, Group project, and Small short paper. You can't complain.

Marianne is very knowledgeable about the subject, this made for an engaging class. She was very open to commentssuggestions and provided a lot of individual feedback on assignments. As noted, this is definitely a class you can do very well in by showing interest in the subject and taking a critical approach to issues. Took the section in english.

Good teacher!  She's french, so the language barrier was a bit difficult for her, but she still brings up many great points.  Her lectures are very informative.  Fairly easy marker if you show interest in the topics being discussed.

This class was very mixed. She was super nice but you learn nothing. It was a class on diversity and I ended up with a great grade, but actually being more prejudice and completely unaware of practical ways to promote diversity in a class. She also doesn't teach to "educators" because so many other majors are in the class.

If you want to take 382, make SURE to take it with Jacky. She shares so many of her personal stories and genuinely loves to teach and open dialogue for students to feel safe and respected. Marking is super easy as long as you ask her for feedback and listen in class! Lecture can feel long but the course is very calm and Jacky makes it enjoyable.
easy to do very well in her courses her assignments are simple and she is a generous marker. you just need to show up and do the work

A lot of work.  A lot of readings and you must never miss a class or she will likely begin to treat you different.  Teaches from a very critical perspective.  Could have been a great course, Diversity in Education, but  it was so demanding that it became difficult to learn and enjoy.  Used to getting A+'s in Education but I dropped significantly.

There aren't many courses I can take and say 'yeah, I really learned something here', or many teachers who I feel empowered by.  But this course was absolutely one of them, and Gerald's that rare kind of prof.  Gerald respectfully asks his students to step back and have a good, hard look at their ideas.  Anyone at Lakehead should take his course!

She is such an inspiring professor who is incredibly knowledgeable and experienced. The course content is interesting; however, due to the length of the class (4 hours), it can become quite boring. The assignments are straightforward, reflect what you are learning and help you unpack the material. low anxiety class. prof is also very caring!

Great prof. She is very passionate about her work. Fair marker and a really caring. She's the kind of person you could go to with a personal problem and she'd try her best to help. I'd definitely take another class with her.

She is so nice and caring. She's always available for questions and is so passionate about the topic. She does a good job in teaching it as well. She is such an easy marker. Sometimes in class when there's an awkward silence in discussions, she also does a great job in saving that and asking better guiding questions, Great prof!
